item.title: Latest Epic Games Store Free Game Comes With a Catch
item.description:
The Epic Games Store has offered a variety of free games during its 2025 holiday giveaway season, and while the lineup of titles has included some true hidden gems, the latest offering has the unfortunate catch of being exclusively co-op. Epic Games revealed that the indie release We Were Here Together will be available for free download on December 26 and 27, but players looking to check out the game will need to make sure they have a friend or family member also willing to grab the game, if they actually want to be able to play it.

We Were Here Together was originally released in 2019 and tasks two players with first-person puzzle-solving gameplay through hostile locations, escape room-style mechanics, and voice communications being the only way to coordinate. Despite mixed reviews for its UI design and occasionally obscure puzzles, We Were Here Together received applause for its complexity progression and engaging narrative. While this would seemingly make it a worthwhile grab for fans of the Epic Games Store giveaways, some players may want to make sure they have a co-op partner to team up with before getting too excited.

We Were Here Together Joins Epic Games Store Freebies for December 2025

It is worth noting that We Were Here Together did receive a major update in October 2025, so some of the older flaws with the game may have been resolved. Another saving grace is the inclusion of cross-play, meaning one user could download the game for free during the Epic Games Store festivities while another could snag the game on Xbox, PlayStation, or Nintendo Switch. Curiously, We Were Here Together is only the second co-op game offered during the Epic Games Store free game giveaways. The first was Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night , though that particular game is mainly a single-player experience that simply offers an additional co-op mode. The other games given away for free by Epic Games Store in December were Hogwarts Legacy , Jotunnslayer: Hordes of Hel , Eternights , Blood West , Sorry We're Closed , Paradise Killer , The Callisto Protocol , and Disco Elysium - The Final Cut .

While there is not necessarily anything negative about a co-op game being included in a free giveaway, We Were Here Together has the unfortunate catch of specifically not being split screen. This means anyone wanting to play it will absolutely need to make sure a co-op partner also downloads the game while it is still free, with the offer expiring at 11am ET / 9am PT on Saturday, December 27. Interested players can follow along for updates on the five other free games coming to Epic Games Store before the end of 2025, along with any other releases slated to make their way to Epic Games Store in 2026.

We Were Here Together

item.title: Some PC Gamers Have Until January 1 To Claim Borderlands 4 and ARC Raiders Bonuses
item.description:
Some PC gamers have until January 1 to claim two in-game cosmetics for ARC Raiders and Borderlands 4 , both available through GeForce Rewards via separate promotions. While Nvidia is footing the bill for these giveaways, their freebies can also be used in the PlayStation and Xbox versions of ARC Raiders and Borderlands 4 —but there's a catch to doing so.

The main caveat is that since both rewards are tied to the Nvidia App, they can only be claimed by owners of an Nvidia GPU. Or, more specifically, by logging into an Nvidia Account on a PC or a laptop equipped with an Nvidia GPU.

GeForce Rewards Offering Cosmetics for ARC Raiders and Borderlands 4 Until the End of the Month

As of December 26, Nvidia is offering two freebies via its GeForce Rewards program: the "Graphics Violence" ECHO-4 Paintjob for Borderlands 4 and the Emerald Wave Variant of the Electrician Backpack for ARC Raiders . Both are formally available until January 1, 2026, or while supplies last. Although it wouldn't be unprecedented for a giveaway to end early due to limited supply, such occurrences remain uncommon for GeForce Rewards.

All Currently Available GeForce Rewards

Reward

Game

Expiry

'Graphics Violence' ECHO-4 Paintjob

Borderlands 4

Jan 1, 2026

Electrician Backpack: Emerald Wave Variant

ARC Raiders

Jan 1, 2026

While both rewards can also be used on PlayStation and Xbox consoles, they can only be claimed by GeForce hardware owners.

The Echo-4 Drone skin that is currently on offer has been available to select PC gamers since late November. Meanwhile, the Nvidia-exclusive Electrician Backpack for ARC Raiders only launched in mid-December 2025. Both items can be claimed by opening the Nvidia App, selecting the "Redeem" tab in the left sidebar, then clicking on the desired freebie. This opens a pop-up window with a bright green "Continue to Redeem" button in the bottom-right corner. Clicking it directs users to Nvidia's official website, which automatically generates a "Redemption Key." The code must then be redeemed on the website of the applicable developer: Gearbox Software for Borderlands 4 and Embark Studios for ARC Raiders .

How To Claim Borderlands 4 and ARC Raiders GeForce Rewards

  • Launch the Nvidia App
  • Navigate to the Redeem tab, then select the desired reward:
    • For Borderlands 4, the app will produce a SHiFT code that needs to be redeemed via Gearbox Software's website.
    • For ARC Raiders, the app will produce a code that needs to be redeemed via Embark Studios' website.

GeForce Rewards' SHiFT Codes Are a Bit 'Smarter' Than Usual Borderlands 4 Coupons

Most of the usual quirks associated with Gearbox’s SHiFT code giveaways also apply to this GeForce Rewards promotion. As expected, the auto-generated key can be redeemed up to four times, i.e., once per platform on which Borderlands 4 is available: Steam, Epic Games Store, PlayStation, and Xbox. That said, this particular SHiFT code behaves more intelligently than Gearbox’s standard giveaways. Ordinarily, SHiFT does not track which platforms a user has already redeemed a code for, forcing players to manually remember their previous selections. Even repeat redemption attempts still present every platform as an option, including those that are no longer valid because they've already been redeemed.

Subscribe for GeForce Rewards tips and giveaway coverage

Get the newsletter to unlock practical guides on GeForce Rewards giveaways, clearer redemption walkthroughs, and platform-specific tips that help you claim in-game cosmetics across supported systems.

Subscribe for GeForce Rewards tips and giveaway coverage

Get the newsletter to unlock practical guides on GeForce Rewards giveaways, clearer redemption walkthroughs, and platform-specific tips that help you claim in-game cosmetics across supported systems.

By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

That's not the case here, as SHiFT codes generated through GeForce Rewards automatically filter out platforms that have already been claimed, continuing to do so until all eligible versions are exhausted. Game Rant can confirm that this quality-of-life improvement does not extend to older Borderlands 4 SHiFT codes that are still active. For instance, the permanently available T9RJB-BFKRR-3RBTW-B33TB-KCZB9 code from the game's credits still lacks any form of automatic platform filtering as of December 26. The process of redeeming an ARC Raiders reward is much more straightforward on account of the game's cross-platform progression that's tied to an Embark ID. In other words, redeeming a Gift Code once is all that's needed to get the Electrician Backpack: Emerald Wave Variant in every version of the hit extraction shooter.

10 /10

ARC Raiders

item.title: The Worst-Rated Games of 2025 That You Might Actually Want To Play (According to OpenCritic Scores)
item.description:
2025 will be remembered as a great year for gaming, at least if we are talking solely about games. Headline stories are a different matter entirely. With Clair Obscur , Silksong , Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , Battlefield 6 , Hades 2 , Donkey Kong Bananza , Split Fiction , Death Stranding 2 , Blue Prince , Ninja Gaiden 4 , Monster Train 2 , Arc Raiders , Ghost of Yotei , Dispatch , Europa Universalis 5 , Sword of the Sea , Mario Kart World , and Dark Deity 2 , you have likely been kept very busy, and that is hardly an exhaustive list of 2025's stellar games.

However, like any other year, 2025 did not solely hit home runs, and it had a few notorious stinkers or disappointments that failed to live up to their potential. Additionally, due to how rankings work, certain games are relegated to the bottom of sites like Open-Critic, forever doomed to be remembered among their year's lowest-rated projects. Should you completely ignore all of 2025's worst games? Or, could a few of them be worth trying in specific circumstances?

Well, you read this article's title, so you know the answer already.

A few things to keep in mind:

  • Open-Critic has not scored every 2025 game, and only titles with aggregates will be considered.
  • The following games were selected from the lowest-rated 65 titles of the year . They are not the 7 absolute worst-rated releases of the year, since they need to be worth playing to an extent. The highest-rated one ranks as the 498th best game of 2025 according to Open-Critic . So, you know, pretty low.
  • I'm not saying the reviews are wrong or that you MUST go out and play these games . For the most part, these games deserve (or deserved) their scores. However, they could be worth playing on a deep sale or if you are craving something really specific.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 (OpenCritic Score: 65)

Campaign Is Bad, But Multiplayer Can Be A Lot Of Fun

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
Released
November 14, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Treyarch, Raven Software
Genre(s)
Action, FPS, Sci-Fi
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

The discourse surrounding Call of Duty has gradually grown more critical over the last few years, and this trend reached its apex with Black Ops 7 . Following a few mediocre entries and going up against the successful debut of Battlefield 6 , the 2025 entry just seemed unnecessary, and this perspective reflected its performance. Don't get me wrong, BO7 was still one of the better-selling games of 2025, but it was not a runaway hit like its predecessors.

Straight up, BO7 's single-player campaign is lackluster and disappointing, and a "65" average accurately reflects its quality. Honestly, it might be a bit kind. However, Call of Duty is primarily about multiplayer nowadays, and BO7 shines far brighter in this area. The maps are generally great, and the gunplay is as rock-solid as ever. Heck, you can even play the campaign in online co-op, which makes it somewhat more enjoyable. Zombies mode is also a blast, which tends to always be the case. Just focusing solely on the multiplayer, BO7 is better than BO6 and MW3 , at the minimum.

While I completely echo the yearning for another great single-player COD campaign, that aspect is just not a priority for the franchise anymore, and it has been that way for roughly a decade.

Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour (OpenCritic Score: 61)

Should Have Been The Switch 2's Pack-In Game

Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour
Released
June 5, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Nintendo
Genre(s)
Mini-Games
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch 2
Powered by

While not a complete repeat of the 1-2-Switch blunder due to it being only $9.99, Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour should have been included with the console. The whole project revolves around the system's tech, with mini-games and trivia designed to educate players on what they just purchased. Like, this is the perfect little distraction for new buyers who want something to do while waiting for Mario Kart World to download. The content is short but relatively engaging, at least if you are interested in this type of thing.

Nintendo used to have such a great history with pack-in titles, but the company has seemingly abandoned the concept for the Switch era. The good thing about Welcome Tour is that it delivers exactly what it promises, making it very easy to predict if you will enjoy it. Does the idea of completing short demos and then answering trivia questions about the Switch 2's tech sound good to you? If the answer is yes, then it might be worth dropping $10 on this release.

Kiborg (OpenCritic Score: 60)

Satisfy Combat Framed By A Frustrating Roguelike System

Kiborg
Action
Roguelike
Beat 'Em Up
Systems
Released
April 30, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Developer(s)
Sobaka Studio
Genre(s)
Action, Roguelike, Beat 'Em Up
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Sobaka's debut game, Redeemer , was so fun that it bought the studio quite a bit of goodwill, at least with me. Kiborg is arguably both the company's best and worst release, and your perception will almost definitely be shaped by your appreciation and tolerance for roguelike progression. You are a prisoner who is trying to escape his ludicrous sentence by taking part in a TV show where you gain freedom by killing everyone and everything. As far as premises go, Kiborg is classic sci-fi, and that is by no means a bad thing.

Similar to the developer's previous effort, Kiborg 's combat is intense, bloody, and visceral. Both you and the enemies hit hard, and you need to stay focused since a few mistakes quickly spell your doom. The controls are responsive and intuitive, and variety is offered through the need to constantly use new weapons. The game is worth playing for its combat, but you need patience to survive the first few hours with your will to continue intact. Kiborg follows pretty much the standard formula for a roguelike, albeit with an onboarding process that is (arguably) among the worst. It will take a LOT of failed runs before you have enough upgrades to properly enhance your base and, more importantly, experiment with build variety.

Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact (OpenCritic Score: 58)

Impressive Fighting Mechanics Buried By Terrible Online Performance (And A Weird Name)

Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact
Fighting
Anime
Systems
Released
July 17, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood and Gore, Language, Partial Nudity, Use of Tobacco, Violence
Developer(s)
Eighting
Genre(s)
Fighting, Anime
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Fun Fact: If you search for "hunter x hunter nen" on Steam, this game doesn't appear. You have to drop the "x" to find it, which is an own-goal that should have been avoided. For a second, I thought Bushiroad had pulled the game from the store.

Anime fighters are synonymous with mediocrity and quick cash grabs, especially with IPs that do not regularly produce games. For example, One-Punch Man: A Hero Nobody Knows sits in my Steam library as a constant reminder that love for the source material can only carry an underwhelming game so far. As beloved as the manga and anime are, Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact was a hard sell when it launched at full price and peaked with 181 players on Steam. Why bother picking up a multiplayer fighting game when it is basically already dead?

Honestly, do not buy Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact if you are looking for an online fighter. The netcode is not great, and you will struggle to find matches in 2026. However, if you are simply craving a tag fighter with enjoyable combat and fun-ish single-player content, you should keep Nen x Impact in mind for when it goes on a deep sale. The gameplay is surprisingly good, and it manages to blend accessibility and depth well. If you just want to mess around with your favorite HxH characters, you can just use auto-combos to get through the story missions. Conversely, people who want to really dive into the mechanics have a well-done tutorial mode at their disposal.

Neptunia Riders VS Dogoos (OpenCritic Score: 54)

With A Steep Discount, Neptunia Fans Might Want To Give This Spin-Off A Try

Neptunia Riders VS Dogoos
Action
Systems
Released
January 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Compile Heart
Genre(s)
Action
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

This one is a special case, as I'm definitely not recommending Neptunia Riders VS Dogoos to everybody. Frankly, I'm recommending it to almost nobody, except people who know and love Neptunia . Just to be crystal clear, "love" is not optional.

Neptunia has a history of producing weird-ish spin-offs that move away from its turn-based RPG routes. Most of these are hack-and-slash musou titles, but Neptunia Riders VS Dogoos shakes things up by going in a genuinely unique direction, and I'm not talking just within the context of this franchise. In an alternate dimension, Uzume has to use her trusty bike to drive over Dogoos, defeat opponents, and help her goddess friends. The vehicle-based gameplay loop involves driving around an arena while running over Dogoos, which allows you to collect them. To win, you have to avoid the wrong Dogoos and collect enough of the right ones before your opponent. Easy enough, and the gameplay is a blast for short sessions where you just want to clear a few stages.

Neptunia Riders VS Dogoos is really short, to the point that you will likely be done with nearly everything in about 5 hours (and that goes beyond the story's length). For all their flaws and repetitiveness, Neptunia games are often lengthy, so this project's brevity is surprising. Also, while fun, the gameplay is pretty shallow. Therefore, it is impossible to recommend this game at its standard price; however, Neptunia projects go on sale relatively frequently, so you can just wait.

Captain Blood (OpenCritic Score: 48)

If You Miss Low-Budget PS3 Games, Then This Game Might Be For You

Captain Blood
4 /10
Released
May 6, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Seawolf Studio, General Arcade
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure, Hack and Slash
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

Full disclosure: I have a ton of nostalgia for janky games from around 2010; in fact, I wrote a whole article expressing my love for these types of releases. As most people probably don't share my fondness for yesteryear's forgotten failures, you should probably take my relative enjoyment of Captain Blood with a grain of salt.

Captain Blood had been stuck in development purgatory since the seventh console generation, and that history is on full display in the final version. This project looks and feels like a low-budget PS3 game that would have been relegated to bargain bins within a year of its release. The visuals would have been rough in 2012, the hack-and-slash combat mimics God of War without any hints of depth, and the production is far from polished.

Subscribe for Candid Game Picks and Worthwhile Buys

Want clearer buying and play choices? Subscribe to the newsletter for honest game coverage, curated takes on overlooked releases, and sale-aware recommendations that help you pick the right titles and avoid duds.

Subscribe for Candid Game Picks and Worthwhile Buys

Want clearer buying and play choices? Subscribe to the newsletter for honest game coverage, curated takes on overlooked releases, and sale-aware recommendations that help you pick the right titles and avoid duds.

By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Captain Blood feels like a time capsule of a bygone era, and there is a certain charm in that. More importantly, character-action games are hard to come by nowadays, especially ones inspired by classic God of War . Sure, Captain Blood is not a great example of the genre, but it is, at least, an example.

MindsEye (OpenCritic Score: 33)

2025's Worst-Rated Game Has Improved Quite A Lot Since Its Debut

MindsEye
Released
June 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Build A Rocket Boy
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure, Third-Person Shooter
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

2025's most infamous game, MindsEye built up quite a bit of hype en route to its debut, only for all that to come crashing down due to a launch version riddled with technical issues. Even beyond the bugs, the game was not particularly fun or interesting; honestly, the glitches were probably the most memorable part.

Now, Build A Rocket Boy and the game's publisher, IOI Partners, deserve all the criticism in the world for launching such a mess of a game. That said, the developer also warrants some praise for their continued support of MindsEye , as Build A Rocket spent the second half of 2025 releasing updates that greatly improved the overall experience. Nowadays, MindsEye is a passable third-person shooter with a better-than-expected story and solid driving mechanics.

If it launched in its current state, the game might have received a score in the high 60s on Open-Critic. Still not amazing, but fine enough. Instead, MindsEye sits among the likes of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5 , Alekhine's Gun , and Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric as one of the worst games ever, according to Open-Critic.

item.title: Where to Find Crackshot's Cabin in Fortnite OG Season 7
item.description:
The OG game mode allows players to live through the events of the first Chapter of Fortnite , whether they played it when it came out in 2018 or are experiencing it for the first time now. Season 7 is winter themed and that remains unchanged in Fortnite OG.

Gamers are tasked with finding Crackshot's Cabin as part of the Greatest Hits Quests in Fortnite OG. They have to explore the snowy landscape that has overtaken the Fortnite map in order to try and locate Crackshot's Cabin. The Battle Royale island is huge, and it could take a while. Thankfully, this guide will tell players where to look for it.

Where to Find Crackshot's Cabin in Fortnite OGsdwd

Where Is Crackshot's Cabin in Fortnite?

Crackshot's Cabin is located on the southwestern part of the map . It was built on the northern side of the mountain that overlooks Frosty Flights from the north . If players are flying over the area, they will easily notice this mountain as a large candy cane has been put right on its peak.

As soon as players enter the cabin, the Greatest Hits Quest will immediately be set to complete, awarding them with 8,000 XP . The cabin's interior contrasts perfect with the desolate scenario outside. While out there it is cold and lonely, inside the fireplace is burning hot, the presents are set, homey pictures are hung above the mantle, creating an extremely cozy atmosphere.

Crackshot's Cabin is riddled with presents, and players can actually open some of them. The presents at Crackshot's Cabin take a bit longer to open compared to chests and they have the same loot spawns. However, unlike the Legendary Present boxes that players can find as loot, they don't guarantee any high-rarity weapons.

Subscribe to the newsletter for Fortnite OG locations

Rediscover Chapter 1 with targeted coverage - subscribe to the newsletter for deep-dive Fortnite OG guides, map spotlights, and nostalgia-driven walkthroughs that highlight classic locations and hidden points of interest.

Subscribe to the newsletter for Fortnite OG locations

Rediscover Chapter 1 with targeted coverage - subscribe to the newsletter for deep-dive Fortnite OG guides, map spotlights, and nostalgia-driven walkthroughs that highlight classic locations and hidden points of interest.

By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Depsite not having any particularly good loot inside, it's still a cozy place worth visiting, as it's been part of Fortnite for nearly 10 years now. It is unknown if fans will ever get the chance to revisit Chapter 1 Season 7 in the future, so it's best to take a look at the cabin while they can.

Fortnite

item.title: GameStop Just Brought Back One of Its Best Deals and You Can Jump on It Right Now
item.description:
The holiday season has once again introduced a number of great discounts and bundles for gamers to save on some of the best titles across PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo, and PC, including one of the best GameStop deals, which allows players to buy 2 pre-owned games and receive 1 additional used title for free. GameStop has offered the deal a number of times in the past, and smart shoppers looking for additional gifts or simply wanting to treat themselves to a few extra presents can now snag some of the biggest gaming titles plus a free bonus.

While various gaming platforms like PlayStation Network, Xbox Game Pass, Nintendo eShop, and Epic Games Store, among many others, often offer their own specialized seasonal video game discounts, GameStop is adding to the festivities with its beloved buy-2-get-1 deal. Fans are able to build out their physical game catalog while also saving a few extra bucks here and there, making it a worthwhile occasion for fans to pick up some additional titles.

GameStop Buy 2, Get 1 Free Deal is Back on for the Holidays 2025

Players have hundreds of games to choose from with GameStop's buy-2-get-1-free-pre-owned deal, ranging from newer 2025 releases like Donkey Kong Bananza for Nintendo Switch 2 and Ghost of Yotei for PlayStation 5 to last-gen launches such as Cuphead for Xbox One and even retro throwbacks with the original Wii Sports up for grabs. GameStop Pro Members can receive additional savings when purchasing in-store or buying online and utilizing in-store pick-up at a brick-and-mortar location. The games eligible for the deal encompass PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo consoles, including the latest hardware and even older systems, like the previously noted Nintendo Wii and the iconic PlayStation 2. A multitude of genres are also represented, ranging from FPS hits like Battlefield 6 and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 to family-friendly offers including Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and Minecraft .

Some of the more surprising games included in the GameStop buy-2-get-1-free deal are much older launches. Full Auto 2 Battlelines for PSP, All Star Baseball 2002 for GameCube, Real Pool for PlayStation 2, and MotionSports: Adrenaline for Xbox 360 are available for those looking to add some more unexpected items to their video game collections. Of course, there are more prolific games on offer, with legendary releases like Super Smash Bros. Ultimate and Animal Crossing: New Horizons for the original Switch, Call of Duty Ghosts , Red Dead Redemption 2 , and The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim Special Edition for PS4, along with Fallout 4 and Grand Theft Auto 5 for Xbox One. Whether looking to grab an old favorite or something newer, the buy-2-get-1-free deal for pre-owned titles is a great opportunity for anyone wanting to expand their gaming library.

A couple of things worth looking into before making any purchases include whether an online subscription to Xbox Game Pass or PlayStation Plus would be worthwhile, as those platforms also include hundreds of older and newer titles and are generally cheaper than buying individual games, and whether it would simply be better to just buy one game and not worry about getting a second just to trigger the third free title. Some may only be looking for one particular game, and it may be more cost-effective to focus on that one rather than adding an additional expense to qualify for the deal. That said, the GameStop offer not only allows players to add the actual physical games to their collections, which is something an online subscription service doesn't provide, but it also makes it easier to pick up multiple potential gifts while the deal is still around.
